info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Columbia County through 245 PM EDT... At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Livingston, or 10 miles east of Saugerties, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chatham, Claverack, Livingston, Clermont, Austerlitz, Philmont, Claverack-Red Mills, Ghent, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Mellenville, Burden, Churchtown, Craryville, Red Rock, Linlithgo Mills, North Hillsdale, Nevis, Arnolds Mill and Brick Tavern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...and east central New York.
